questions.question: How did the dust storm affect the people at the camp?

choices.answer: Dust covers everything & everybody, causing valley fever
The fine particles make their way into mama’slungs.
People were forced to seek shelter, dirt covers crops.
All of above
It's a town near the farm where they work in California
It means to "pre judge" without understanding facts
It means to farm with dirt from the storm.
Not sure.

questions.question: Which one is an example of Prejudice in the book?

choices.answer: When Tio Luis tried to blackmail Mama into marrying him.
Everybody is allowed to live in whatever shacks they want.
When Isabel wasn't chosen to be "Queen of the May" .

questions.question: How does Esperanza console Isabel for not being crowned Queen of the May?

choices.answer: Talks to her about how she needs to work harder.
She gives Isabel the porcelain doll her father gave her.
She gives her mango popsicles.

questions.question: What did Abuelita find in the garden at the convent which she interpreted as a sign?

choices.answer: She found an injured bird, she didn't think it'd fly again.
She found Esperanza’s first quilt.
She found Esperanza's favorite flowers.
Abuelita found a rose bush with lots of thorns

questions.question: How did Esperanza measure her time since she’d left Aguascalientes?

choices.answer: she measured time by the fruits and vegetables
By months and days.
She lost track but knows it feels like years.

questions.question: Why does she measure time by fruits and vegetables?

choices.answer: She can't find a calendar.
Crops are harvested in certain months at certain times
Certain crops only grow in certain years
Papa died and their home burnt down.
She lost her wealth and home to Tio Luis.
Abuelita, her mother, had to stay in Mexico.
All of the above.

questions.question: Why is striking risky to do?

choices.answer: They won't get paid during the days they aren't working.
They could get tired from striking all day.
People who strike could lose their home and their jobs.

questions.question: Josefina asks, “How couldanyone starve with so much food around?” Why is this statement ironic?

choices.answer: Even though they harvest the crops they can't have any.
People just don't like eating fruits and vegetables.
All the food is rotten.

questions.question: What advice does Esperanza give Isabel at the end of the book?

choices.answer: Don't start over, just keep going.
Pricking your finger is bad luck.
10 stitches up and 9 stitches down.
Do not be afraid to start over.
The dust storm came, breaking up their striking group.
The immigration officers came loading everybody on buses
They were told they would lose their homes unless they stop.
People were taken to Mexico whether they were Mexican or not

questions.question: Esperanza shares a moment with Miguel at the end of the book. What is it?

choices.answer: They crochet a blanket together.
Listening to the heart beat of the land.
Miguel sings a birthday song to Esperanza.

questions.question: Why does Marta warnEsperanza and Miguel about the strike?

choices.answer: Marta knew she had to do what was needed to help her mother.
She actually wants Esperanza to strike, it was just a test.
Marta worries about Miguel striking.

questions.question: Why did Abuelita not jointhem in the United States sooner, after she got well?

choices.answer: She became terrified of traveling.
She didn’t want to leave her home again.
Abuelita was being watched and followed by Tío Luis’ spies.
